cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles S of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW today, turning NW then NNW through Wednesday, aiming for the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA border) then accelerating NE across the Mid-South toward the Ohio Valley by the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Texas–Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West and the Dry Tortugas (TS watch/warning); Hurricane & Storm-Surge watches expected later for NW Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for portions of Cuba, Cayman Islands, and the lower Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba’s southern and western coastline, Florida Keys, and north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds (20–30 mph) possible late Saturday as the remnant depression passes south of Lake Erie
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Great Lakes water level changes not expected to exceed normal variability
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rainfall possible Saturday–Sunday as remnants of Laura sweep through the Ohio Valley
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief thunderstorm squalls could cause temporary visibility reductions for vessel movements on the Maumee River
